info.name: Vocation of the Shepherd
info.description: Shepherd vocation for the Redeemer class from Tanares RPG 5e.
info.author: Dragori Games

description.p: Redeemers who follow the Shepherd vocation are those whose mission given by Tamera in their dreams, even if they are not aware of it, is to bring balance and soothe the masses so that their emotions do not generate penumbral creatures. In addition, controlling the emotions of the masses ensures that wars are less likely to happen. Shepherds are excellent leaders of crowds, often religious leaders, prophets, and healers.

At 2nd level, you gain proficiency in Religion. If you are alredy proficient, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability checks you make that uses this skill. In addition, you have advantage on Charisma checks related to gathering groups, crowds, or audiences to listen to you.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Charisma checks related to gathering groups, crowds, or audiences to listen to you.

description.p: At 2nd level, you receive a special marking on your character sheet called the Cycle of Redemption. The position to which you move the marker on the Cycle, when you use one of your rays, will guarantee you a unique benefit, which will last until the beginning of your next turn.

After taking a long rest, you determine your starting position on the Cycle and then place a marker on your character sheet in the chosen position. You move this marker every time you declare firing one of your Rays. The position you will be in at the end of this move will determine the benefit you will receive until the beginning of your next turn. You do not receive any benefits if you did not use your action to perform a ray in your turn.

The movement happens before the ray is shot, so all benefits to moving in a new position are applied before the ray is used. This movement still happens if you are using Magic in Rays, and is also applied before the spell is cast.

description.p: Positive Ray (ABCDEFABCDE...)
Negative Ray (AECAEC...)(BFDBFD...)

A - When unleashing a ray, you can shoot an extra ray of the same type towards a separate target. Starting at 10th level, you can release two additional rays towards two distinct targets, excluding your original target.

B - Prior to firing your ray, you can instantly move 20 feet. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks and occurs before the ray is discharged. From the 10th level, this movement increases to 30 feet.
C - Until your next turn starts, all your saving throws receive a bonus equivalent to your Charisma modifier. From the 10th level, gain your Charisma modifier plus 2 as the bonus

D - The temporary hit points granted by your Positive Ray increase by 2d4, and the damage inflicted by your Negative Ray increases by 2d6. From the 10th level, this extra bonus rises to 3d4 and 3d6, respectively.
E - Your rays’ magical attack rolls receive a +3 bonus and can bypass half cover and three-quarter cover. From the 10th level, this bonus increases to +5.
F - Until your next turn starts, creatures suffer disadvantage when executing ranged attacks against you. From the 10th level, you also gain +2 AC against all ranged attacks aimed at you.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, when making a move in your Cycle of Redemption, you can choose to move twice instead of just once. You can only use this ability again after a short or long rest.

sheet.description: When making a move in your Cycle of Redemption, you can choose to move twice instead of just once.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, your positive ray grants your target advantage on all saves imposed by unnatural creatures (penumbral creatures, Ungods, undead, aberrations, or as determined by your GM in other settings) until your next turn starts. At 9th level, each time you employ your positive ray using the Magic in Ray ability, you also heal 1d8 hit points of your target in addition to other effects.

description.p: At 3rd, 7th, 10th, 13th and 16th levels, following the table below, you learn a new spell, which counts as a cleric spell for you and doesn’t count against your number of spells known.
Starting at 6th level, when you release one of your rays, add your Charisma modifier to the damage dealt or the temporary hit points provided by your ray.

sheet.description: When you release one of your rays, add your Charisma modifier to the damage dealt or the temporary hit points provided by your ray.

description.p: At 10th level, if you fail a Charisma ability check when addressing a crowd or group, you can swiftly rephrase your argument, enabling you to reroll the check and take the new result. You can use this ability a number of times equivalent to your Charisma modifier. You regain all uses after a long rest.

description.p: Starting at 15th level, your role as a Shepherd provides you with exceptional skills in engaging with crowds and building trust with individual members. When making a Charisma (Performance) check to interact with a non-hostile group of at least three creatures, you can add your proficiency bonus in Deception or Persuasion to the check in addition to your proficiency in Performance. If the check succeeds, you capture the absolute attention of the creatures, instilling trust in them during the interaction, and they have a disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks for anything besides you during this period.

description.p: At 18th level, you can once per day influence a group of creatures by bending their will to your commands. Any individual who can hear and comprehend your speech for 1 minute must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. A creature that fails will pursue the course of action you described as if affected by the suggestion spell, behaving this way until the order is completed or 7 days have passed. The course of action must be expressed in one or two sentences, and follows the same restrictions and limitations as the suggestion spell.

This effect isn’t considered magical but is instead the result of your powerful persuasiveness, so affected creatures will feel persuaded rather than enchanted or manipulated. Affected creatures have advantage on saving throws against any effect that would compel them to act against your suggestion.
